column1: Apolipoprotein CII (apoCII) is a protein found in large fat particles that the gastrointestinal tract absorbs.

High levels of apoCII may be due to: - Angina pectoris (chest pain that occurs with activity or stress) - A family history of lipoprotein lipase deficiency, a condition in which the body does not break down fats normally - Heart attack Low apoCII levels are seen in people with a rare condition called familial apoprotein CII deficiency.
